explanation: The report is correct. In the implementation of ws_receive_frame the parameter frame is only read (indexed and used to compute masks and message bytes) and never modified. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 advises that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible. Therefore frame can and should be declared as pointing to const (for example: static unsigned char *ws_receive_frame(const unsigned char *frame, ssize_t *length, int *type);). Doing so prevents accidental modification of the referenced data and conforms to the rule. Note: when changing the prototype, update any corresponding function-pointer types or declarations as needed, but ordinary calls with non-const pointers remain valid because C permits implicit conversion from T * to const T *.
